page.lettertext:
fol.110r
Belgia
1591 stilo Ro
m
12 March To M
r
Bodly
Belgia: 1591: March:
S
r
I alwayse singe owr songe
we lak money for yett we have none
butt hope by your good meanes not longe to wait:
I am very glad to hear the fury for
France
is somwhatt abated, and
ill doute my selfe will be required
butt I putt my hole trust in yowe
and
S
r
Francis
by whose good meanes
som one state or other may [dash]
me out of this life and thinke me
worthy to serve the m:
Verdugo
is com into thes part
, and
hath wewed all the townes hear about
and taken order for theyr vittuling
and the better fortefying of [Sulfild], other
newes hear is none
thus commending
my self to your good favor I leve
yow to the almighty
dusborgh
this
xij
th
of march
1590
Yo
r
most affectionat Frind to do yow servis Oliver Lambert
